verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:36
verses.text: "The Lord is at hand, in nothing be anxious".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:37
verses.text: For why, tell me? do they ever rise in opposition? And if ye see them living in luxury, why are ye in affliction? Already the judgment is nigh; shortly will they give account of their actions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:38
verses.text: Are ye in affliction, and they in luxury? But these things shall shortly receive their end.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:39
verses.text: Do they plot against you, and threaten you? "In nothing be anxious".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:40
verses.text: The judgment is already at hand, when these things shall be reversed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:41
verses.text: "In nothing be anxious".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:42
verses.text: If ye are kindly affected toward those who prepare evil against you, yet it shall not at last turn out to their profit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:43
verses.text: Already the recompense is at hand, if poverty, if death, if aught else that is terrible be upon you.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:44
verses.text: "But in everything, by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known unto God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:45
verses.text: There is this for one consolation, "the Lord is at hand".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:46
verses.text: And again, "I will be with you alway, even unto the end of the world".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:47
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:48
verses.text: xxviii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:49
verses.text: ) Behold another consolation, a medicine which healeth grief, and distress, and all that is painful.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:50
verses.text: And what is this? Prayer, thanksgiving in all things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:51
verses.text: And so He wills that our prayers should not simply be requests, but thanksgivings too for what we have.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:52
verses.text: For how should he ask for future things, who is not thankful for the past? "But in everything by prayer and supplication".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:53
verses.text: Wherefore we ought to give thanks for all things, even for those which seem to be grievous, for this is the part of the truly thankful man.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:54
verses.text: In the other case the nature of the things demands it; but this springs from a grateful soul, and one earnestly affected toward God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:55
verses.text: God acknowledgeth these prayers, but others He knoweth not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:56
verses.text: Offer up such prayers as may be acknowledged; for He disposeth all things for our profit, though we know it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:57
verses.text: And this is a proof that it greatly profiteth, namely, that we know it not.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:58
verses.text: "And the peace of God which passeth all understanding shall guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:59
verses.text: What meaneth this? "The peace of God" which He hath wrought toward men, surpasseth all understanding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:60
verses.text: For who could have expected, who could have hoped, that such good things would have come? They exceed all man's understanding, not his speech alone.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:61
verses.text: For His enemies, for those who hated Him, for those who determined to turn themselves away, for these, he refused not to deliver up His Only Begotten Son, that He might make peace with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:62
verses.text: This peace then, i-e: the reconciliation, the love of God, shall guard your hearts and your thoughts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:63
verses.text: For this is the part of a teacher, not only to exhort, but also to pray, and to assist by supplication, that they may neither be overwhelmed by temptations, nor carried about by deceit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:64
verses.text: As if he had said, May He who hath delivered you in such sort as mind cannot comprehend, may He Himself guard you, and secure you, so that you suffer no ill.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:65
verses.text: Either he means this, or that that peace of which Christ saith, "Peace I leave with you, My peace I give unto you" (John xiv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:66
verses.text: ): this shall guard you, for this peace exceedeth all man's understanding.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:67
verses.text: How? When he tells us to be at peace with our enemies, with those who treat us unjustly, with those who are at war and enmity toward us; is it not beyond man's understanding? But rather let us look to the former.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:68
verses.text: If the peace surpasseth all understanding, much more doth God Himself, who giveth peace, pass all understanding, not ours only, but also that of Angels, and the Powers above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:69
verses.text: What meaneth "in Christ Jesus"? Shall guard us in Him, so that ye may remain firm, and not fall from His faith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:70
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:71
verses.text: "Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are honorable, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are just".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:72
verses.text: What is "Finally"? It stands for, "I have said all".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:73
verses.text: It is the word of one that is in haste, and has nothing to do with present things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:74
verses.text: "Finally, brethren, whatsoever things are honorable, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things are just, whatsoever things are pure, whatsoever things are lovely, whatsoever things are of good report, if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:75
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:76
verses.text: "The things which ye both learned and received, and heard and saw in me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:77
verses.text: What meaneth, "whatsoever things are lovely"? Lovely to the faithful, lovely to God.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:78
verses.text: "Whatsoever things are true".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:79
verses.text: Virtue is really true, vice is falsehood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:80
verses.text: For the pleasure of it is a falsehood, and its glory is falsehood, and all things of the world are falsehood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:81
verses.text: "Whatsoever things are pure".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:82
verses.text: This is opposed to the words "who mind earthly things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:83
verses.text: "Whatsoever things are honorable".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:84
verses.text: This is opposed to the words "whose god is their belly".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:85
verses.text: "Whatsoever things are just," i-e: saith he, "whatsoever things are of good report".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:86
verses.text: "If there be any virtue, if there be any praise".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:87
verses.text: Here he willeth them to take thought of those things too which regard men.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:88
verses.text: "Think on these things," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:89
verses.text: Seest thou, that he desires to banish every evil thought from our souls; for evil actions spring from thoughts.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:90
verses.text: "The things which ye both learned and received".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:91
verses.text: This is teaching, in all his exhortations to propose himself for a model: as he saith in another place, "even as ye have us for an ensample".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:92
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:93
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:94
verses.text: ) And again here, "What things ye learned and received," i-e: have been taught by word of mouth, "and heard and saw in me": both in respect of my words and actions and conduct.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:95
verses.text: Seest thou, how about everything he lays these commands on us? For since it was not possible to make an accurate enumeration of all things, of our coming in, and going out, and speech, and carriage, and intercourse (for of all these things it is needful that a Christian should have thought), he said shortly, and as it were in a summary, "ye heard and saw in me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:96
verses.text: I have led you forward both by deeds and by words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:97
verses.text: "These things do," not only in words, but do them also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:98
verses.text: "And the God of peace shall be with you," i-e: ye shall be in a calm, in great safety, ye shall suffer nothing painful, nor contrary to your will.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:99
verses.text: For when we are at peace with Him, and we are so through virtue, much more will He be at peace with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:100
verses.text: For He who so loved us, as to show favor to us even against our will, will He not, if He sees us hastening toward Him, Himself yet much more exhibit His love toward us?  Nothing is such an enemy of our nature as vice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:101
verses.text: And from many things it is evident, how vice is at enmity with us, and virtue friendly toward us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:102
verses.text: What will ye? That I should speak of fornication? It makes men subject to reproach, poor, objects of ridicule, despicable to all, just as enemies treat them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:103
verses.text: Ofttimes it hath involved men in disease and danger; many men have perished or been wounded in behalf of their mistresses.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:104
verses.text: And if fornication produces these things, much rather doth adultery.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:105
verses.text: But doth almsgiving so? By no means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:106
verses.text: But as a loving mother setteth her son in great propriety, in good order, in good report, and gives him leisure to engage in necessary work, thus alms-giving doth not release us nor lead us away from our necessary work, but even renders the soul more wise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:107
verses.text: For nothing is more foolish than a mistress.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:108
verses.text: But what willest thou? To look upon covetousness? It too treats us like an enemy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:109
verses.text: And how? It makes us hated by all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:110
verses.text: It prepareth all men to vaunt themselves against us; both those who have been treated unjustly by us, and those who have not, who share the grief of the former, and are in fear for themselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:111
verses.text: All men look upon us as their common foes, as wild beasts, as demons.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:112
verses.text: Everywhere are there innumerable accusations, plots against us, envyings, all which are the acts of enemies.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:113
verses.text: But justice, on the contrary, makes all men friends, all men sociable, all men well disposed towards us, by all men prayers are made in our behalf; our affairs are in perfect safety, there is no danger, there is no suspicion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:114
verses.text: But sleep also fearlessly comes over us with perfect safety, no care is there, no lamenting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:115
verses.text: How much better this sort of life is! And what? Is it best to envy, or to rejoice with one another? Let us search out all these things, and we shall find that virtue, like a truly kind mother, places us in safety, while vice is a treacherous thing, and full of danger.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:116
verses.text: For hear the prophet, who saith, "The Lord is a stronghold of them that fear Him, and His covenant is to show them".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:117
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:118
verses.text: xxv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:119
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:120
verses.text: ) He feareth no one, who is not conscious to himself of any wickedness; on the contrary, he who liveth in crime is never confident, but trembles at his domestics, and looks at them with suspicion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:121
verses.text: Why say, his domestics? He cannot bear the tribunal of his own conscience.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:122
verses.text: Not only those who are without, but his inward thoughts affect him likewise, and suffer him not to be in quiet.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:123
verses.text: What then, saith Paul? Ought we to live dependent on praise? He said not, look to praise, but do praiseworthy actions, yet not for the sake of praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:124
verses.text: "Whatsoever things are true," for the things we have been speaking of are false.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:125
verses.text: "Whatsoever things are honorable".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:126
verses.text: That which is "honorable" belongs to external virtue, that which is "pure" to the soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:127
verses.text: Give no cause of stumbling, saith he, nor handle of accusation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:128
verses.text: Because he had said, "Whatsoever things are of good report," lest you should think that he means only those things which are so in the sight of men, he proceeds, "if there be any virtue, and if there be any praise, think on these things"—do these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:129
verses.text: He wills us ever to be in these things, to care for these things, to think on these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:130
verses.text: For if we will be at peace with each other, God too will be with us, but if we raise up war, the God of peace will not be with us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:131
verses.text: For nothing is so hostile to the soul as vice.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:132
verses.text: That is, peace and virtue place it in safety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:133
verses.text: Wherefore we must make a beginning on our part, and then we shall draw God toward us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:134
verses.text: God is not a God of war and fighting.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:135
verses.text: Make war and fighting to cease, both that which is against Him, and that which is against thy neighbor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:136
verses.text: Be at peace with all men, consider with what character God saveth thee.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:137
verses.text: "Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called sons of God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:138
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:139
verses.text: v.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:140
verses.text: ) Such always imitate the Son of God: do thou imitate Him too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:141
verses.text: Be at peace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:142
verses.text: The more thy brother warreth against thee, by so much the greater will be thy reward.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:143
verses.text: For hear the prophet who saith, "With the haters of peace I was peaceful".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:144
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:145
verses.text: cxx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:146
verses.text: , Sept.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:147
verses.text: ) This is virtue, this is above man's understanding, this maketh us near God; nothing so much delighteth God as to remember no evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:148
verses.text: This sets thee free from thy sins, this looseth the charges against thee: but if we are fighting and buffeting, we become far off from God: for enmities are produced by conflict, and from enmity springs remembrance of evil.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:149
verses.text: Cut out the root, and there will be no fruit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:150
verses.text: Thus shall we learn to despise the things of this life, for there is no conflict, none, in spiritual things, but whatever thou seest, either conflicts or envy, or whatever a man can mention, all these spring from the things of this life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:151
verses.text: Every conflict hath its beginning either in covetousness, or envy, or vainglory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:152
verses.text: If therefore we are at peace, we shall learn to despise the things of the earth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:153
verses.text: Hath a man stolen our money? He hath not injured us, only let him not steal our treasure which is above.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:154
verses.text: Hath he hindered thy glory? Yet not that which is from God, but that which is of no account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:155
verses.text: For this is no glory, but a mere name of glory, or rather a shame.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:156
verses.text: Hath he stolen thy honor? Rather not thine but his own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:157
verses.text: For as he who committeth injustice doth not so much inflict as receive injustice, thus too he who plots against his neighbor, first destroyeth himself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:158
verses.text: For "he who diggeth a pit for his neighbor, falleth into it".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:159
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:160
verses.text: xxvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:161
verses.text: ) Let us then not plot against others, lest we injure ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:162
verses.text: When we supplant the reputation of others, let us consider that we injure ourselves, it is against ourselves we plot.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:163
verses.text: For perchance with men we do him harm, if we have power, but we injure ourselves in the sight of God, by provoking Him against us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:164
verses.text: Let us not then harm ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:165
verses.text: For as we injure ourselves when we injure our neighbors, so by benefiting them we benefit ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:166
verses.text: If then thy enemy harm thee, he hath benefited thee if thou art wise, and so requite him not with the same things, but even do him good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:167
verses.text: But the blow, you say, remains severe.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:168
verses.text: Consider then that thou dost not benefit, but punishest him, and benefitest thyself, and quickly you will come to do him good.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 15:169
verses.text: What then? Shall we act from this motive? We ought not to act on this motive, but if thy heart will not hear other reason, induce it, saith he, even by this, and thou wilt quickly persuade it to dismiss its enmity, and wilt for the future do good to thine enemy as to a friend, and wilt obtain the good things which are to come, to which God grant that we may all attain in Christ Jesus, Amen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:1
verses.text: Homily XV.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:2
verses.text: Philippians iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:3
verses.text: –  "But I rejoice in the Lord greatly, that now at length ye have revived your thought for me; wherein ye did indeed take thought, but ye lacked opportunity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:4
verses.text: Not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therein to be content.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:5
verses.text: I know how to be abused, and I know also how to abound: in everything and in all things have I learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in want.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:6
verses.text: I can do all things in him that strengtheneth me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:7
verses.text: Howbeit, ye did well, that ye had fellowship with my affliction".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:8
verses.text: I have ofttimes said, that almsgiving hath been introduced not for the sake of the receivers, but of the givers, for the latter are they which make the greatest gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:9
verses.text: And this Paul shows here also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:10
verses.text: In what way? The Philippians had sent him somewhat, after a long time, and had committed the same to Epaphroditus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:11
verses.text: See then, how when he is about to send Epaphroditus as the bearer of this Epistle, he praises them, and shows that this action was for the need, not of the receiver, but of the givers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:12
verses.text: This he doth, both that they who benefited him may not be lifted up with arrogance, and that they may become more zealous in well-doing, since they rather benefit themselves; and that they who receive may not fearlessly rush forward to receive, lest they meet with condemnation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:13
verses.text: For "it is more blessed," He saith, "to give than to receive".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:14
verses.text: (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:15
verses.text: ) Why then does he say, "I rejoice in the Lord greatly"? Not with worldly rejoicing, saith he, nor with the joy of this life, but in the Lord.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:16
verses.text: Not because I had refreshment, but because ye advanced; for this is my refreshment.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:17
verses.text: Wherefore he also saith "greatly"; since this joy was not corporeal, nor on account of his own refreshment, but because of their advancement.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:18
verses.text: And see how, when he had gently rebuked them on account of the times that were passed, he quickly throweth a shadow over this, and teacheth them constantly and always to remain in well doing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:19
verses.text: "Because at length," saith he.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:20
verses.text: The words, "at length," show long time to have elapsed.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:21
verses.text: "Ye have revived," as fruits which have shot forth, dried up, and afterwards shot forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:22
verses.text: Here he showeth, that being at first blooming, then having faded, they again budded forth.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:23
verses.text: So that the word "flourished again," has both rebuke and praise.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:24
verses.text: For it is no small thing, that he who hath withered should flourish again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:25
verses.text: He showeth also, that it was from indolence all this had happened to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:26
verses.text: But here he signifies, that even in former time they were wont to be zealous in these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:27
verses.text: Wherefore he addeth, "your thought for me, wherein ye did indeed take thought".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:28
verses.text: And lest you should think, that in other things too they had been more zealous, and had then withered, but in this thing alone, behold how he has added, "your thought for me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:29
verses.text: I apply the words, "now at length," only to this; for in other things it is not so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:30
verses.text: Here some one may enquire, how when he had said, "It is more blessed to give than to receive" (Acts xx.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:32
verses.text: ); and, "These hands ministered to my necessities, and to them that were with me"; and again when writing to the Corinthians, "For it were good for me rather to die, than that any man should make my glorying void" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:33
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:34
verses.text: ); he suffereth his glorying to be made void? And how? By receiving.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:35
verses.text: For if his glorying was, that he received not, how doth he now endure so to do? What is it then? Probably, he then did not receive on account of the false Apostles, "that wherein they glory" ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:36
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:37
verses.text: ), saith he, "they may be found even as we".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:38
verses.text: And he said not "are," but "glory"; for they received but secretly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:39
verses.text: Wherefore he said, "wherein they glory".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:40
verses.text: Wherefore he also said, "No man shall stop me of this glorying".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:41
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:42
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:43
verses.text: ) And he said not simply, shall not stop me, but what? "in the regions of Achaia".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:44
verses.text: And again, "I robbed other Churches, taking wages of them that I might minister unto you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:45
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:46
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:47
verses.text: ) Here he showed that he did receive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:48
verses.text: But Paul indeed received rightly, having so great a work; if in truth he did receive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:49
verses.text: But they who work not, how can they receive? "Yet I pray," saith one.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:50
verses.text: But there is no work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:51
verses.text: For this may be done together with work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:52
verses.text: "But I fast".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:53
verses.text: Neither is this work.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:54
verses.text: For see this blessed one, preaching in many places, and working too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:55
verses.text: "But ye lacked opportunity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:56
verses.text: What meaneth lacked opportunity? It came not; saith he, of indolence, but of necessity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:57
verses.text: Ye had it not in your hands, nor were in abundance.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:58
verses.text: This is the meaning of, "Ye lacked opportunity".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:59
verses.text: Thus most men speak, when the things of this life do not flow in to them abundantly, and are in short supply.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:60
verses.text: "Not that I speak in respect of want".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:61
verses.text: I said, saith he, "now at length," and I rebuked you, not seeking mine own, nor censuring you on this account, as if I were in want: for I sought it not on this account.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:62
verses.text: Whence is this, O Paul, that thou makest no vain boasting? To the Corinthians he saith, "For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or even acknowledge".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:63
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:64
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:65
verses.text: ) And in this case he would not have spoken to them so as to be convicted, he would not, had he been making boasts, have spoken thus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:66
verses.text: He was speaking to those who knew the facts, with whom detection would have been a greater disgrace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:67
verses.text: "For I have learnt," saith he, "in whatsoever state I am, therein to be content".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:68
verses.text: Wherefore, this is an object of discipline, and exercise, and care, for it is not easy of attainment, but very difficult, and a new thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:69
verses.text: "In whatsoever state I am," saith he, "therein to be content.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:70
verses.text: I know how to be abased, and I know also how to abound.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:71
verses.text: In everything and in all things have I learned the secret".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:72
verses.text: That is, I know how to use little, to bear hunger and want.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:73
verses.text: "Both to abound, and to suffer need".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:74
verses.text: "But, says one, there is no need of wisdom or of virtue in order to abound".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:75
verses.text: There is great need of virtue, not less than in the other case.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:76
verses.text: For as want inclines us to do many evil things, so too doth plenty.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:77
verses.text: For many ofttimes, coming into plenty, have become indolent, and have not known how to bear their good fortune.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:78
verses.text: Many men have taken it as an occasion of no longer working.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:79
verses.text: But Paul did not so, for what he received he consumed on others, and emptied himself for them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:80
verses.text: This is to know.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:81
verses.text: He was in nowise relaxed, nor did he exult at his abundance; but was the same in want and in plenty, he was neither oppressed on the one hand, nor rendered a boaster on the other.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:82
verses.text: "Both to be filled," saith he, "and to be hungry, both to abound, and to be in want".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:83
verses.text: Many know not how to be full, as for example, the Israelites, "ate, and kicked" (Deut.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:84
verses.text: xxxii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:85
verses.text: ), but I am equally well ordered in all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:86
verses.text: He showeth that he neither is now elated, nor was before grieved: or if he grieved, it was on their account, not on his own, for he himself was similarly affected.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:87
verses.text: "In everything," saith he, "and in all things I have learned the secret," i-e: I have had experience of all things in this long time, and these things have all succeeded with me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:88
verses.text: But since boasting might seem to have a place here, see how quickly he checks up, and says, "I can do all things in Christ that strengtheneth me".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:89
verses.text: The success is not mine own, but His who has given me strength.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:90
verses.text: But since they who confer benefits, when they see the receiver not well affected toward them, but despising the gifts, are themselves rendered more remiss, (for they considered themselves as conferring a benefit and refreshment,) if therefore Paul despises the refreshment, they must necessarily become remiss, in order then that this may not happen, see how he healeth it again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:91
verses.text: By what he hath said above, he hath brought down their proud thoughts, by what followeth he maketh their readiness revive, by saying, "Howbeit ye did well, that ye had fellowship with my affliction".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:92
verses.text: Seest thou, how he removed himself, and again united himself to them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:93
verses.text: This is the part of true and spiritual friendship.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:94
verses.text: Think not, saith he, because I was not in want, that I had no need of this act of yours.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:95
verses.text: I have need of it for your sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:96
verses.text: How then, did they share his afflictions? By this means.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:97
verses.text: As he said when in bonds, "Ye all are partakers with me of grace".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:98
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:99
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:100
verses.text: ) For it is grace to suffer for Christ, as he himself saith in another place, "For to you it is given from God not only to believe on Him, but also to suffer for Him".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:101
verses.text: (Philip.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:102
verses.text: i.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:103
verses.text: ) For since those former words by themselves might have made them regardless, for this cause he consoleth them, and receiveth them, and praiseth them again.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:104
verses.text: And this in measured words.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:105
verses.text: For he said not, "gave," but "had fellowship," to show that they too were profited by becoming partakers of his labors.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:106
verses.text: He said not, ye did lighten, but ye did communicate with my affliction, which was something more elevated.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:107
verses.text: Seest thou the humility of Paul? seest thou his noble nature? When he has shown that he had no need of their gifts on his own account, he afterward uses freely such lowly words as they do who make a request; "since thou art wont to give".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:108
verses.text: For he refuseth neither to do, nor say anything.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:109
verses.text: That is, "Think not that my words show want of shame, wherein I accuse you, and say, 'Now at length ye have revived,' or are those of one in necessity; I speak not thus because I am in need, but why? From my exceeding confidence in you, and of this also ye yourselves are the authors".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:110
verses.text: Seest thou how he sootheth them? How are ye the authors? In that ye hasted to the work before all the others; and have given me confidence to remind you of these things.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:111
verses.text: And observe his elevation; he accuseth them not while they did not send, lest he should seem to regard his own benefit, but when they had sent, then he rebuked them for the time past, and they received it, for he could not seem after that to regard his own benefit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:112
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:113
verses.text: "Ye yourselves also know, ye Philippians, that in the beginning of the Gospel, when I departed from Macedonia, no Church had communicated with me, as concerning giving and receiving, but ye only".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:114
verses.text: Lo, how great is his commendation! For the Corinthians and Romans are stirred up by hearing these things from him, whilst the Philippians did it without any other Church having made a beginning.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:115
verses.text: For "in the beginning of the Gospel," saith he, they manifested such zeal towards the holy Apostle, as themselves first to begin, without having any example, to bear this fruit.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:116
verses.text: And no one can say that they did these things because he abode with them, or for their own benefit; for he saith, "When I departed from Macedonia, no Church had fellowship with me, in the matter of giving and receiving, but ye only".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:117
verses.text: What meaneth "receiving," and what "had fellowship"? Wherefore said he not, "no Church gave to me," but "had fellowship with me, in the matter of giving and receiving"? Because it is a case of communication.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:118
verses.text: He saith, "If we sowed unto you spiritual things, is it a great matter if we shall reap your carnal things".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:119
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:120
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:121
verses.text: ) And again, "That your abundance may be a supply to their want".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:122
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:123
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:124
verses.text: ) How did they communicate? In the matter of giving carnal things, and receiving spiritual.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:125
verses.text: For as they who sell and buy communicate with each other, by mutually giving what they have, (and this is communication,) so too is it here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:126
verses.text: For there is not anything more profitable than this trade and traffic.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:127
verses.text: It is performed on the earth, but is completed in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:128
verses.text: They who buy are on the earth, but they buy and agree about heavenly things, whilst they lay down an earthly price.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:129
verses.text: But despond not; heavenly things are not to be bought with money, riches cannot purchase these things, but the purpose of him who giveth the money, his true wisdom, his superiority to earthly things, his love toward man, his mercifulness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:130
verses.text: For if money could purchase it, she who threw in the two mites would have gained nothing great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:131
verses.text: But since it was not the money, but the purpose that availed, she received everything, who exhibited a full purpose of mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:132
verses.text: Let us not then say, that the Kingdom can be bought with money; it is not by money, but by purpose of mind which is exhibited by the money.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:133
verses.text: Therefore, will one answer, there is no need of money? There is no need of money, but of the disposition; if thou hast this, thou wilt be able even by two mites to purchase Heaven; where this is not, not even ten thousand talents of gold will be able to do that, which the two mites could.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:134
verses.text: Wherefore? Because if thou who hast much throwest in but a small portion, thou gavest an alms indeed, but not so great as the widow did; for thou didst not throw it in with the same readiness as she.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:135
verses.text: For she deprived herself of all she had, or rather she deprived not, but gave it all as a free gift to herself.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:136
verses.text: Not for a cup of cold water hath God promised the kingdom, but for readiness of heart; not for death, but for purpose of mind.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:137
verses.text: For indeed it is no great thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:138
verses.text: For what is it to give one life? that is giving one man; but one man is not of worth enough.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:139
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:140
verses.text: "For even in Thessalonica, ye sent once and again unto my need".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:141
verses.text: Here again is great praise, that he, when dwelling in the metropolis, should be nourished by a little city.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:142
verses.text: And lest, by always withdrawing himself from the supposition of want, he should, as I said at first, render them amiss, having previously shown by so many proofs that he is not in want, he here does it by one word only, by saying "needs".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:143
verses.text: And he said not "my," but absolutely,—having a care of dignity.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:144
verses.text: And not this only, but what followeth too, for since he was conscious that it was a very lowly thing, he again secures it, by adding as a correction,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:145
verses.text: "Not that I seek for the gift".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:146
verses.text: As he said above, "Not that I speak in respect of want"; that is stronger than this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:147
verses.text: For it is one thing, that he who is in want, should not seek, and another that he who is in want should not even consider himself to be in want.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:148
verses.text: "Not that I seek for the gift," he says, "but I seek for the fruit, that increaseth to your account".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:149
verses.text: Not mine own.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:150
verses.text: Seest thou, that the fruit is produced for them? This say I for your sake, says he, not for my own, for your salvation.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:151
verses.text: For I gain nothing when I receive, but the grace belongeth to the givers, for the recompense is yonder in store for givers, but the gifts are here consumed by them who receive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:152
verses.text: Again even his desire is combined with praise and sympathy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:153
verses.text: When he had said, I do not seek, lest he should again render them remiss, he adds,  Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:154
verses.text: "But I have all things and abound," i-e: through this gift ye have filled up what was wanting, which would make them more eager.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:155
verses.text: For benefactors, the wiser they are, the more do they seek gratitude from the benefited.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:156
verses.text: That is, ye have not only filled up what was deficient in former time, but ye have gone beyond.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:157
verses.text: For lest by these words he should seem to accuse them, see how he seals up all.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:158
verses.text: After he had said, "Not that I seek for the gift," and "Now at length"; and had shown that their deed was a debt, for this is meant by, "I have all," then again he showeth, that they had acted above what was due, and saith, "I have all things and abound, I am filled".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:159
verses.text: I say not this at hazard, or only from the feeling of my mind, but why? "Having received of Epaphroditus the things that came from you, an odor of a sweet smell; a sacrifice acceptable, well pleasing to God".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:160
verses.text: Lo, whither he hath raised their gift; not I, he saith, received, but God through me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:161
verses.text: Wherefore though I be not in need, regard it not, for God had no need, and He received at their hands in such sort, that the Holy Scriptures shrunk not from saying, "God smelled a sweet savor" (Gen.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:162
verses.text: viii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:163
verses.text: ), which denotes one who was pleased.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:164
verses.text: For ye know, indeed ye know, how our soul is affected by sweet savors, how it is pleased, how it is delighted.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:165
verses.text: The Scriptures therefore shrunk not from applying to God a word so human, and so lowly, that it might show to men that their gifts are become acceptable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:166
verses.text: For not the fat, not the smoke, made them acceptable, but the purpose of mind which offered them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:167
verses.text: Had it been otherwise, Cain's offering too had been received.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:168
verses.text: It saith then, that He is even pleased, and how He is pleased.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:169
verses.text: For men could not without this have learned.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:170
verses.text: He then, who hath no need, saith that He is thus pleased, that they may not become remiss by the absence of need.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:171
verses.text: And afterward, when they had no care for other virtues, and trusted to their offerings alone, behold, how again he setteth them right by saying, "Will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?" (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:172
verses.text: l.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:173
verses.text: ) This Paul also saith.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:174
verses.text: "Not that I seek," saith he, "for the gift".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:175
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:176
verses.text: "And may my God fulfill every need of yours, according to His riches in glory, in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:177
verses.text: Behold how he invokes blessings upon them, as poor men do.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:178
verses.text: But if even Paul blesseth those who give, much more let us not be ashamed to do this when we receive.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:179
verses.text: Let us not receive as though we ourselves had need, let us not rejoice on our own account, but on that of the givers.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:180
verses.text: Thus we too who receive shall have a reward, if we rejoice for their sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:181
verses.text: Thus we shall not take it hardly, when men do not give, but rather shall grieve for their sake.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:182
verses.text: So shall we render them more zealous, if we teach them, that not for our own sake do we so act; "but may my God" fulfill every need of yours, or every grace, or every joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:183
verses.text: If the second be true, "every grace," he meaneth not only the alms, which are of earth, but every excellency.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:184
verses.text: If the first, "your every need," which I think too should rather be read, this is what he means to show.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:185
verses.text: As he had said, "ye lacked opportunity," he here maketh an addition, as he doth in the Epistle to the Corinthians, saying, "And He that supplieth seed to the sower, may He supply bread for food, and multiply your seed for sowing, and increase the fruits of your righteousness".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:186
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:187
verses.text: ix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:188
verses.text: ) He invokes blessings upon them, that they may abound, and have wherewith to sow.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:189
verses.text: He blesseth them too, not simply that they might abound, but "according to His riches," so that this too is done in measured terms.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:190
verses.text: For had they been as he was, so truly wise, so crucified, he would not have done this; but since they were men that were handicraftsmen, poor, having wives, bringing up children, ruling their families, and who had given these very gifts out of small possessions, and had certain desires of the things of this world, he blesseth them appropriately.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:191
verses.text: For it is not unseemly to invoke sufficiency and plenty upon those who thus use them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:192
verses.text: See too what he said.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:193
verses.text: He said not, May He make you rich, and to abound greatly; but what said he? "May He fulfill every need of yours," so that ye may not be in want, but have things for your necessities.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:194
verses.text: Since Christ too, when He gave us a form of prayer, inserted also this in the prayer, when He taught us to say,  "Give us this day our daily bread".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:195
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:196
verses.text: vi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:197
verses.text: )  "According to His riches".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:198
verses.text: That is, according to His free gift, i-e: it is easy to Him, and possible, and quickly.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:199
verses.text: And since I have spoken of need, do not think that he will drive you into straits.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:200
verses.text: Wherefore he added, "according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:201
verses.text: So shall all things abound to you, that you may have them to His glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:202
verses.text: Or, ye are wanting in nothing; (for it is written, "great grace was upon them all, neither was there any that lacked".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:203
verses.text: ) (Acts iv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:204
verses.text: ) Or, so as to do all things for His glory, as if he had said, that ye may use your abundance to His glory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:205
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:206
verses.text: "Now unto our God and Father be the glory for ever and ever, Amen".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:207
verses.text: For the glory of which he speaks belongs not only to the Son, but to the Father too, for when the Son is glorified, then is the Father also.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:208
verses.text: For when he said, This is done to the glory of Christ, lest any one should suppose that it is to His glory alone, he continued, "Unto our God and Father be the glory," that glory which is paid to the Son.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:209
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:210
verses.text: "Salute every saint in Christ Jesus".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:211
verses.text: This also is no small thing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:212
verses.text: For it is a proof of great good will, to salute them through letters.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:213
verses.text: "The brethren which are with me salute you".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:214
verses.text: And yet thou saidst that thou hast "no one like-minded, who will care truly for your state".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:215
verses.text: How then sayest thou now, "The brethren which are with me"? He either saith, "The brethren which are with me," because he hath no one like-minded of those who are with him, (where he doth not speak of those in the city, for how were they constrained to undertake the affairs of the Apostles?) or that he did not refuse to call even those brethren.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:216
verses.text: Ver.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:218
verses.text: "All the saints salute you, especially they that are of Caesar's household.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:219
verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:220
verses.text: He elevated them and strengthened them, by showing that his preaching had reached even to the king's household.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:221
verses.text: For if those who were in the king's palace despised all things for the sake of the King of Heaven, far more ought they to do this.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:222
verses.text: And this too was a proof of the love of Paul, and that he had told many things of them, and said great things of them, whence he had even led those who were in the palace to a longing for them, so that those who had never seen them saluted them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:223
verses.text: Especially because the faithful were then in affliction, his love was great.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:224
verses.text: And those who were absent from each other were closely conjoined together as if real limbs.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:225
verses.text: And the poor man was similarly disposed toward the rich, and the rich toward the poor, and there was no preëminence, in that they were all equally hated and cast out, and that for the same cause.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:226
verses.text: For as, if captives taken from divers cities should arise and come to the same towns, they eagerly embrace each other, their common calamity binding them together; thus too at that time they had great love one toward another, the communion of their afflictions and persecutions uniting them.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:227
verses.text: Moral.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:228
verses.text: For affliction is an unbroken bond, the increase of love, the occasion of compunction and piety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:229
verses.text: Hear the words of David, "It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I might learn Thy statutes".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:230
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:231
verses.text: cxix.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:232
verses.text: ) And again another prophet, who saith, "It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:233
verses.text: (Lam.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:234
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:235
verses.text: ) And again, "Blessed is the man whom Thou chastenest, O Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:236
verses.text: (Ps.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:237
verses.text: xciv.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:238
verses.text: ) And another who saith, "Despise not the chastening of the Lord".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:239
verses.text: (Prov.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:240
verses.text: iii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:241
verses.text: ) And "if thou come near to serve the Lord, prepare thy soul for temptation".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:242
verses.text: (Ecclus.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:243
verses.text: xi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:244
verses.text: ) And Christ also said to His disciples, "In the world ye shall have tribulation, but be of good cheer".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:245
verses.text: (John xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:246
verses.text: ) And again, "Ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:247
verses.text: (John.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:248
verses.text: xvi.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:249
verses.text: ) And again, "Narrow and straitened is the way".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:250
verses.text: (Matt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:251
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:252
verses.text: ) Dost thou see how tribulation is everywhere lauded, everywhere assumed as needful for us? For if in the contests of the world, no one without this receiveth the crown, unless he fortify himself by toil, by abstinence from delicacies, by living according to rule, by watchings, and innumerable other things, much more so here.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:253
verses.text: For whom wilt thou name as an instance? The king? Not even he liveth a life free from care, but one burdened with much tribulation and anxiety.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:254
verses.text: For look not to his diadem, but to his sea of cares, by which the crown is produced for him.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:255
verses.text: Nor look to his purple robe, but to his soul, which is darker than that purple.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:256
verses.text: His crown doth not so closely bind his brow, as care doth his soul.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:257
verses.text: Nor look to the multitude of his spearmen, but to the multitude of his disquietudes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:258
verses.text: For it is not possible to find a private house laden with so many cares as a king's palace.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:259
verses.text: Violent deaths are each day expected, and a vision of blood is seen as they sit down to eat and drink.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:260
verses.text: Nor can we say how oft he is disturbed in the night season, and leaps up, haunted with visions.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:261
verses.text: And all this in peace; but if war should overtake him, what could be more piteous than such a life as this! What evils has he from those that are his own, I mean, those who are under his dominion.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:262
verses.text: Nay, and of a truth the pavement of a king's house is always full of blood, the blood of his own relations.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:263
verses.text: And if ye will, I will also relate some instances, and ye will presently know; chiefly old occurrences—but also some things that have happened in our own times—yet still preserved in memory.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:264
verses.text: One, it is said, having suspected his wife of adultery, bound her naked upon mules, and exposed her to wild beasts, though she had already been the mother to him of many princes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:265
verses.text: What sort of life, think ye, could that man have lived? For he would not have broken out into such vengeance, had he not been deeply affected with that distress.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:266
verses.text: Moreover, this same man slew his own son, or rather his brother did so.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:267
verses.text: Of his sons, the one indeed slew himself when seized by a tyrant, and another put to death his cousin, his colleague in the kingdom, to which he had appointed him; and saw his wife destroyed by pessaries, for when she bore not, a certain wretched and miserable woman (for such indeed she was who thought to supply the gift of God by her own wisdom) gave her pessaries, and destroyed the queen, and herself perished with her.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:268
verses.text: And this man is said to have also killed his own brother.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:269
verses.text: Another again, his successor, was destroyed by noxious drugs, and his cup was to him no longer drink, but death.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:270
verses.text: And his son had an eye put out, from fear of what was to follow, though he had done no wrong.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:271
verses.text: It is not befitting to mention how another ended his life miserably.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:272
verses.text: And after them, one was burnt, like some miserable wretch, amongst horses, and beams, and all sorts of things, and left his wife in widowhood.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:273
verses.text: For it is not possible to relate the woes which he was compelled to undergo in his lifetime, when he rose up in revolt.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:274
verses.text: And hath not he who now rules, from the time he received the crown, been in toil, in danger, in grief, in dejection, in misfortune, exposed to conspiracies? Such is not the kingdom of heaven, but after it is received, there is peace, life, joy, delight.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:275
verses.text: But as I said, life cannot be without pain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:276
verses.text: For if in the affairs of this world even he who is accounted most happy, if the king is burdened with so many misfortunes, what thinkest thou must be true of private life? I cannot say how many other evils there are! How many stories have ofttimes been woven on these subjects! For nearly all the tragedies of the stage, as well as the mythical stories, have kings for their subjects.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:277
verses.text: For most of these stories are formed from true incidents, for it is thus they please.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:278
verses.text: As for example, Thyestes' banquet, and the destruction to all that family by their misfortunes.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:279
verses.text: These things we know from the writers that are without: but if ye will, I will adduce instances from the Scripture too.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:280
verses.text: Saul was the first king, and ye knew how he perished, after experiencing numberless ills.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:281
verses.text: After him, David, Solomon, Abia, Hezekiah, Josiah, in like sort.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:282
verses.text: For it is not possible, without affliction and toil, and without dejection of mind, to pass through the present life.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:283
verses.text: But let us be cast down in mind, not for such things as these, for which kings grieve, but for those things, whence we (thus) have great gain.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:284
verses.text: "For godly sorrow worketh repentance unto salvation, a repentance which bringeth no regret".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:285
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:286
verses.text: vii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:287
verses.text: ) On account of these things we should be grieved, for these things we should be pained, for these things we should be pricked at heart; thus was Paul grieved for sinners, thus did he weep.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:288
verses.text: "For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote unto you in many tears".

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:289
verses.text: ( Cor.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:290
verses.text: ii.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:291
verses.text: ) For when he had no cause of grief on his own account, he did so on account of others, or rather he accounted those things too to be his own, at least as far as grief went.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:292
verses.text: Others were offended, and he burned; others were weak, and he was weak: such grief as this is good, is superior to all worldly joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:293
verses.text: Him who so grieves I prefer to all men, or rather the Lord Himself pronounces them blessed, who so grieve, who are sympathizing.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:294
verses.text: I do not so much admire him in dangers, or rather I do not admire him less for the dangers by which he died daily, yet this still more captivates me.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:295
verses.text: For it came of a soul devoted to God, and full of affection: from the love which Christ Himself seeketh: from a brotherly and a fatherly sympathy, or rather, of one greater than both these.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:296
verses.text: Thus we should be affected, thus weep; such tears as these are full of great delight; such grief as this is the ground of joy.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:297
verses.text: And say not to me: What do they for whom I grieve gain by my so doing? Though we no way profit them for whom we grieve, at all events we shall profit ourselves.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:298
verses.text: For he who grieveth thus on account of others, much more will so do for himself; he who thus weepeth for the sins of others will not pass by his own transgressions unwept, or rather, he will not quickly sin.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:299
verses.text: But this is dreadful, that when we are ordered so to grieve for them that sin, we do not even exhibit any repentance for our own sins, but when sinning remain without feeling, and have care for and take account of anything, rather than our own sins.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:300
verses.text: For this cause we rejoice with a worthless joy, which is the joy of the world, and straightway quenched, and which brings forth griefs innumerable.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:301
verses.text: Let us then grieve with grief which is the mother of joy, and let us not rejoice with joy which brings forth grief.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:302
verses.text: Let us shed tears which are the seeds of great joy, and not laugh with that laughter, which brings forth the gnashing of teeth for us.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:303
verses.text: Let us be afflicted with affliction, from which springs up ease, and let us not seek luxury, whence great affliction and pain is born.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:304
verses.text: Let us labor a little time upon the earth, that we may have continual enjoyment in heaven.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:305
verses.text: Let us afflict ourselves in this transitory life, that we may attain rest in that which is endless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:306
verses.text: Let us not be remiss in this short life, lest we groan in that which is endless.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:307
verses.text: See ye not how many are here in affliction for the sake of worldly things? Consider that thou also art one of them, and bear thy affliction and thy pain, feeding on the hope of things to come.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:308
verses.text: Thou art not better than Paul or Peter, who never obtained rest, who passed all their life in hunger and thirst and nakedness.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:309
verses.text: If thou wouldest attain the same things with them, why journeyest thou along a contrary road? If thou wouldest arrive at that City, of which they have been deemed worthy, walk along the path which leadeth thither.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:310
verses.text: The way of ease leadeth not thither, but that of affliction.

verses.name: Chrysostom: On Philippians 16:311
verses.text: The former is broad, the latter is narrow; along this let us walk, that we may attain eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord, with whom, to the Father, together with the Holy Ghost, be honor, might, power, now and ever, and world without end, Amen.
